Does this parameter "total-bandwidth-usage-KB-sec" count against 

(1) down=
loaded data, or
(2) saved data (into arc files).

The reason why I ask this=
 question is, I added a filter in the write-
processor so that we do not st=
ore anything that is of image/* 
content. as far as I know, unless heritrix=
 downloads the content, 
one has no way to get the content-type header (hen=
ce the content 
filter in the writer-processor).  Here is the configuration=
 of the 
filter.

<map name=3D"filters">
  <newObject name=3D"no-imgcnt" 
c=
lass=3D"org.archive.crawler.filter.ContentTypeRegExpFilter">
  <boolean nam=
e=3D"enabled">true</boolean>
  <boolean name=3D"if-match-return">false</boo=
lean>
    <string name=3D"regexp">(.*/(css|x-javascript|javascript|octet-
s=
tream|x-shockwave-flash)|(i|I)mage/.*|video/.*|audio/.*)
    </string>
  </=
newObject>
</map>

I also setup the parameter "total-bandwidth-usage-KB-sec=
" to 
1150KB/s. But I'm observing an average of 1277KB. My co-location 
fac=
ility stats shows me higher bandwidth usage than that. Usually 
this parame=
ter is very reliable in restricting bandwidth use. I am 
wondering if the t=
otal-bandwidth is counted against the actual saved 
content (which is small=
er than the downloaded content in my case) or 
data transferred on the wire=
? If it's former that would probably 
explain why the actual bandwidth used=
 is higher than my specified 
value.

Cheers,
-Joe
